revised_title: Immunity Experiments on the Naturally Infected Dog Strain of Trypanosome
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to determine if the Naturally Infected Dog strain of the trypanosome causing disease in man in Nyasaland would protect against other strains. They found that the Naturally Infected Dog strain did not provide immunity against the Human, Wild, and Zululand strains of the trypanosome. This study is important for understanding disease transmission and potential treatments for trypanosomiasis.
